hardcover-fiction.description: The third book in the Empyrean series. As enemies gain traction, Violet Sorrengail goes beyond the Aretian wards in search of allies.
hardcover-fiction.title: ONYX STORM
hardcover-fiction.author: Rebecca Yarros

hardcover-fiction.description: The second book in the Empyrean series. Violet Sorrengail’s next round of training under the new vice commandant might require her to betray the man she loves.
hardcover-fiction.title: IRON FLAME
hardcover-fiction.author: Rebecca Yarros

hardcover-fiction.description: The 60th book of the In Death series. Eve Dallas investigates the mysterious death of someone who was in a secret organization.
hardcover-fiction.title: BONDED IN DEATH
hardcover-fiction.author: J.D. Robb

hardcover-fiction.description: A reimagining of “Adventures of Huckleberry Finn” shines a different light on Mark Twain's classic, revealing new facets of the character of Jim.
hardcover-fiction.title: JAMES
hardcover-fiction.author: Percival Everett

hardcover-fiction.description: In 1965, a nursing student follows her brother to serve during the Vietnam War and returns to a divided America.
hardcover-fiction.title: THE WOMEN
hardcover-fiction.author: Kristin Hannah

hardcover-fiction.description: In 1995, a hapless journalist must protect a girl from forces that seek to control her.
hardcover-fiction.title: THE BONES BENEATH MY SKIN
hardcover-fiction.author: TJ Klune

hardcover-fiction.description: A woman who is down on her luck forms an unexpected bond with the bride at a wedding in Rhode Island.
hardcover-fiction.title: THE WEDDING PEOPLE
hardcover-fiction.author: Alison Espach

hardcover-fiction.description: When a 13-year-old girl disappears from an Adirondack summer camp in 1975, secrets kept by the Van Laar family emerge.
hardcover-fiction.title: THE GOD OF THE WOODS
hardcover-fiction.author: Liz Moore

hardcover-fiction.description: In 1953, a woman goes to Paris to uncover the truth about the death of her friend during World War II.
hardcover-fiction.title: LAST TWILIGHT IN PARIS
hardcover-fiction.author: Pam Jenoff

hardcover-fiction.description: Told from different points of view, the 50-year relationship between Abe and Jane is brought to life.
hardcover-fiction.title: THIS IS A LOVE STORY
hardcover-fiction.author: Jessica Soffer

hardcover-fiction.description: Collects the novels “Dragons of Autumn Twilight,” “Dragons of Winter Night” and “Dragons of Spring Dawning.”
hardcover-fiction.title: DRAGONLANCE CHRONICLES
hardcover-fiction.author: Margaret Weis and Tracy Hickman
hardcover-fiction.contributor: by Margaret Weis and Tracy Hickman

hardcover-fiction.description: Violet Sorrengail is urged by the commanding general, who also is her mother, to become a candidate for the elite dragon riders.
hardcover-fiction.title: FOURTH WING
hardcover-fiction.author: Rebecca Yarros

hardcover-fiction.description: The second book in the Nytefall series. Shifting alliances and impending doom add pressure to Astraea and Nyte’s tenuous relationship.
hardcover-fiction.title: THE NIGHT IS DEFYING
hardcover-fiction.author: Chloe C. Peñaranda

hardcover-fiction.description: The 40th book in the Alex Delaware series. Delaware and Sturgis try to get to the bottom of a series of murders in Hollywood.
hardcover-fiction.title: OPEN SEASON
hardcover-fiction.author: Jonathan Kellerman

hardcover-fiction.description: A widow working the night shift at the Sowell Bay Aquarium is aided in solving a mystery by a giant Pacific octopus living there.
hardcover-fiction.title: REMARKABLY BRIGHT CREATURES
hardcover-fiction.author: Shel Van Pelt

hardcover-nonfiction.description: The philanthropist and co-founder of Microsoft describes events from his childhood and discovery of computers.
hardcover-nonfiction.title: SOURCE CODE
hardcover-nonfiction.author: Bill Gates

hardcover-nonfiction.description: A co-author of “The Coddling of the American Mind” looks at the mental health impacts that a phone-based life has on children.
hardcover-nonfiction.title: THE ANXIOUS GENERATION
hardcover-nonfiction.author: Jonathan Haidt

hardcover-nonfiction.description: The travel writer and TV host recounts his journey from Istanbul to Kathmandu in the 1970s.
hardcover-nonfiction.title: ON THE HIPPIE TRAIL
hardcover-nonfiction.author: Rick Steves

hardcover-nonfiction.description: The MSNBC host considers the ways in which attention capitalism affects politics and society.
hardcover-nonfiction.title: THE SIRENS' CALL
hardcover-nonfiction.author: Chris Hayes

hardcover-nonfiction.description: Three years after the sudden death of her partner, the Pulitzer Prize-winning author spent time on a remote island to grieve his loss.
hardcover-nonfiction.title: MEMORIAL DAYS
hardcover-nonfiction.author: Geraldine Brooks

hardcover-nonfiction.description: The author of “Braiding Sweetgrass” illuminates how the gift economy in the natural world works and draws lessons for our economy; with illustrations by John Burgoyne.
hardcover-nonfiction.title: THE SERVICEBERRY
hardcover-nonfiction.author: Robin Wall Kimmerer

hardcover-nonfiction.description: In a collection of essays, the Peabody Award- and James Beard Award-winning chef and TV host chronicles his career.
hardcover-nonfiction.title: FOOD FOR THOUGHT
hardcover-nonfiction.author: Alton Brown

hardcover-nonfiction.description: The first lady describes her work as a fashion model, marriage to Donald Trump and time in the White House.
hardcover-nonfiction.title: MELANIA
hardcover-nonfiction.author: Melania Trump

hardcover-nonfiction.description: A look at recent scientific research on aging and longevity.
hardcover-nonfiction.title: OUTLIVE
hardcover-nonfiction.author: Peter Attia with Bill Gifford
hardcover-nonfiction.contributor: by Peter Attia with Bill Gifford

hardcover-nonfiction.description: The editor at large of Jewish Currents and a contributing opinion writer at The New York Times evaluates potential narratives following the war in Gaza.
hardcover-nonfiction.title: BEING JEWISH AFTER THE DESTRUCTION OF GAZA
hardcover-nonfiction.author: Peter Beinart

hardcover-nonfiction.description: Our criminal justice system viewed through the struggles of 10 wrongfully convicted people to achieve exoneration.
hardcover-nonfiction.title: FRAMED
hardcover-nonfiction.author: John Grisham and Jim McCloskey
hardcover-nonfiction.contributor: by John Grisham and Jim McCloskey

hardcover-nonfiction.description: Franke gives an account of abuse within her family, who gained a following with their YouTube channel “8 Passengers.”
hardcover-nonfiction.title: THE HOUSE OF MY MOTHER
hardcover-nonfiction.author: Shari Franke

hardcover-nonfiction.description: A memoir by the cookbook author and Food Network host known as the Barefoot Contessa.
hardcover-nonfiction.title: BE READY WHEN THE LUCK HAPPENS
hardcover-nonfiction.author: Ina Garten

hardcover-nonfiction.description: The conservative commentator evaluates the legacies of American presidents.
hardcover-nonfiction.title: CONFRONTING THE PRESIDENTS
hardcover-nonfiction.author: Bill O'Reilly and Martin Dugard
hardcover-nonfiction.contributor: by Bill O'Reilly and Martin Dugard

hardcover-nonfiction.description: The author of “The Code Breaker” traces Musk’s life and summarizes his work on electric vehicles, private space exploration and artificial intelligence.
hardcover-nonfiction.title: ELON MUSK
hardcover-nonfiction.author: Walter Isaacson
